field_bio.value: Mudasir leads the engineering and maintenance efforts for ConstructAfrica's digital platforms and proprietary IT infrastructure, with a focus on server configurations, DevOps practices, and programming. He brings a wealth of experience in developing web and digital applications for a diverse range of enterprise and business environments.

field_bio.value: Richard Scott is a chartered civil engineer and investment management professional with over 16 years industry experience, most of which has been spent developing, financing and operating renewables energy projects across the world. Richard has previously worked for a number of developers and investors in Africa, including Joule Africa, Berkeley Energy and Meridiam with a focus on geothermal, hydro, solar and wind. Richard has extensive experience in Africa having lived in Kenya, Uganda, Sierra Leone and Ethiopia. He currently works within the investment management team at SSE renewables in the UK.

field_bio.value: Jide Ehizele has a degree in economics, which provides a useful basis for understanding demand levels, cost and revenue structures within the railway industry. As well as skills and competencies acquired from both degree and work experience within the public and private sectors, he has subsequently gained experience of a range of railway data and systems.

field_bio.value: Vladyslav Zdravchev is an information technology specialist, and the CEO of AMgrade.  AMgrade is a firm of IT professionals that helps businesses solve challenging technology problems with software. AMgrade's headquarters is in Rijswijk, Holland. AMgrade also has offices in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine.

field_bio.value:
Elekanyani Ndlovu is an experienced executive, board member, businesswoman and thought leader in her field.

She graduated with a degree in electrical engineering from The University of Cape Town and has been technically trained to solve problems, taking into consideration how things fit and work together, always questioning how systems can be innovated and transformed. As a critical thinker and analyst by nature, Elekanyani shares these insights and experiences as a podcast host and keynote speaker, with a future focused multi-disciplinary lense.

field_bio.value:
Andres Vega is an international associate at Centurion Law Group and has extensive experience in the implementation, development and financing of oil and gas and energy projects in some of the most important energy markets in the world.

Andres obtained his LL.M. degree from the University of California, Berkeley School of Law in 2016, with a Certificate in Energy and Clean Technology. He received his law degree from the Universidad Iberoamericana, Mexico, in 2012. Andres is admitted to practice in Mexico (2012) and in the State of New York (2018).

field_bio.value: Roger Long is director and head of valuation and advisory services at Broll Property Group, South Africa. Roger has an MBA from the Edinburgh Business School, Heriott-Watt University, Scotland. He is a Fellow of the Royal Institute of Chartered Surveyors (RICS).

field_bio.value: Kelly-Ann Mealia is co-founder and chairperson of Energy Capital & Power (ECP). ECP is an Africa-focused global investment platform for the energy sector. Since 2016, ECP has been bringing together energy stakeholders the entire energy value chain (from oil & gas exploration to renewable power) to connect, network and invest on the African continent through a series of events, online content and investment reports.

attributes.name: Victor Ongoma

field_bio.value:
Victor is a meteorologist specialising in climatology and climate change. He holds a PhD in Meteorology from Nanjing University of Information Science and Technology, China, attained in 2017. His PhD thesis focused on the variability of extreme climate events over East Africa. Victor earned his MSc and BSc (Meteorology) from the University of Nairobi in Kenya in 2012 and 2009, respectively.

He is an assistant professor at Mohammed VI Polytechnic University in Morocco. Prior to joining academia, he worked as a meteorologist for the Kenyan government.

attributes.field_job_t: Assistant Professor, Universit Mohammed VI Polytechnique

field_bio.value: Ambrose Kessy is a professor of public administration at the University of Dodoma. He has a PhD in development policy and management from the University of Manchester, UK. He graduated from the University of Dar es Salaam with a BA in political science and public administration and also has an MA in public administration.

field_bio.value: David Richard Walwyn is a professor of technology management at the University of Pretoria in South Africa. He has a BSc in chemical engineering from the University of Cape Town and a PhD from the University of Cambridge, in the UK.

field_bio.value: Janeck Winand is managing director South Africa at Siemens Gamesa.
